original_title: Anti Terrorism Bill will NOT be tabled in Parliament today (26) – Justice Minister
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka's Justice Minister Dr. Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe said the proposed Anti-Terrorism Bill will NOT be tabled in Parliament on Wednesday (26).
He said the proposed bill that has led to much controversy locally, and internationally, will be tabled in due course.
Sri Lanka plans to introduce the Anti-Terrorism Bill to replace the already controversial Prevention of Terrorism Act.
10-hour Water Cut on Saturday (29) for Ethul Kotte, Rajagiriya and surrounding areas
‘Do NOT table Anti-Terror Bill in its current form’ – Human Rights Commission writes to President
